intro: Phaca robbinsii, commonly known as the Robbins' phaca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Phaca robbinsii is often found in wetland ecosystems and is an important part of the local flora.
